name: Rabbit Fricassee With Tomatoes and White Wine
keywords: dry white wine, rabbit, tomato, gluten-free, nut-free, main course, spring
recipeIngredient: Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
3 cloves garlic, boiled in their skins

recipeInstructions.text: Season the rabbit with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet and brown the rabbit pieces a few at a time. Add the wine, scraping up the cooking juices, sprinkle with thyme, cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes, turning occasionally. If the sauce gets too dry, add a little water. Simmer the garlic cloves in their skins in water for 20 minutes.
Add the tomatoes to the rabbit, and cook for another 15 minutes. Test the rabbit for doneness. When it is ready, mash the garlic into the sauce, discarding the skins. Swirl in the butter and serve.
